Rasa Chatbot

28 Aug 2019 - Abwao

Rasa is an open source software package with user friendly tools to design, train and build contextual artificial intelligence chatbots.

Prerequisites

  • You‚Äôll need to have some experience with Python; at least how to install it and how to install packages with pip.
  • For Windows users, you‚Äôll need to ensure Microsoft VC++ Compiler is installed. Please see Windows Prerequisites.

Installation

This simple getting started guide will see you through installation, and even create a sample Rasa project that you can try out right away. I‚Äôd recommend going through the Rasa Tutorial, and working in a new folder.

Editing the Files

Now comes the tricky part - giving the chatbot a brain and a personality.

First the brains. The chatbot understands a user‚Äôs input by learning the various intents and entities in the nlu.md file, which is in the data directory/folder. Please see Training Data Format. You can add as many intents as you wish - just be careful to make their respective examples distinct so that the chatbot doesn‚Äôt get mixed up.

The stories in stories.md give the chatbot sample conversation flows, so that it can learn how natural conversations would go. Please see Stories. Slots and Forms are the chatbots memory.

The domain file - domain.yml - is like the body of the chatbot (brains, limbs, mouth and all). It specifies the intents & entities the bot should know; the slots and forms it should store, the actions it can take and the templates (things it can say). Please see Domains.

For twe adjustments to the endpoints.yml, config.yml, credentials.yml, and actions.py files, I‚Äôd recommend taking some time to go through the Rasa Docs. They‚Äôre really good and well detailed. It‚Äôs the best way to find out exactly what‚Äôs happening behind the scenes, and how you can mould the chatbot in line with how you envisioned it.
